sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: StarterCode is an advanced lightweight SPA framework built with HTML, TailwindCSS, and Alpine.js. It runs entirely in the browser with zero build steps, featuring a custom engine for components, layouts, routing, and state management.

sections.title: Installation
sections.content: Start by cloning the repository to your local machine.

subsections.heading: Running the Project
subsections.content: Since this framework uses fetch() to load components, you must serve it via a local server to avoid CORS errors.

sections.title: Basic Routing
sections.content: Routes are defined in routes.js. Each route maps a URL path to a component file.

sections.title: Dynamic Routes
sections.content: Create dynamic routes with URL parameters using the colon syntax. You can use multiple parameters in a single route.

sections.title: Accessing Route Parameters
sections.content: Parameters are automatically available in the global Store. Access them in your components via `Alpine.store('params')`.

sections.title: Navigation
sections.content: Navigate using standard anchor tags with hash URLs.

sections.title: Creating Components
sections.content: Components are HTML files stored in app/components/ that can be reused across pages.

sections.title: Using Components with Include
sections.content: Use the include tag to add components to your pages and pass properties.

code.snippet:
<include src="app/components/card.html" 
         title="Welcome" 
         description="This is a card component">
</include>

sections.title: Core Engine Flow
sections.content:
When a page is rendered, the framework follows this process:

1. Fetch HTML file
2. Process layouts (wrap content)
3. Process includes (replace component tags)
4. Transform templates (convert {{ }} syntax)
5. Sanitize HTML (prevent XSS)
6. Inject into DOM
7. Reinitialize Alpine.js

modules.name: engine.js
modules.description: Handles HTML loading, component includes, layouts, and template transformation

modules.name: router.js
modules.description: Implements hash-based routing with URL parameter parsing

modules.name: store.js
modules.description: Manages global state with Alpine integration

modules.name: ui.js
modules.description: Provides utility functions for skeleton loaders, caching, etc.

sections.title: Component Design
tips: Keep components single-responsibility - each component should do one thing well
Use named slots for flexible composition over props
Prefix CSS classes with component name to avoid conflicts

sections.title: Performance Optimization
tips: Cache JSON responses to reduce API calls
Use skeleton loaders for better UX while loading
Use Alpine's :key binding for list items

sections.title: Code Organization
tips: Extract reusable logic into helper functions

sections.title: Security
tips: Always sanitize user input with DOMPurify
Don't trust data from external APIs
Validate data on the client-side before display
Keep Alpine.js version up to date
